qas.question: What type of anthropology originated as a sub-focus group?
When did the division of cyborg anthropology originate?
What the sub-group of cyborg anthropology very closely related to, in addition to STS?

answers.text: the Society for the Social Studies of Science

qas.question: What does cyborg anthropology study about humankind and technological systems humans have built?
What type of anthropology began in Europe in 1993?
When did the study of cyborg technology begin?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Cyborg<a0_0/> anthropology<b5_0/> originated as a sub-focus group within the American Anthropological Association's annual meeting in <a1_0>1993<a1_0/>. The sub-group was very closely related to STS and <a2_0>the Society for the Social Studies of Science<a2_0/>. <a3_0>Donna Haraway<a3_0/>'s <b6_0>1985<b6_0/> <b7_0>Cyborg Manifesto<b7_0/> could be considered the founding document of cyborg anthropology by first exploring the philosophical and sociological ramifications of the term. Cyborg anthropology studies humankind and <a4_0>its relations<a4_0/> with the technological systems it has built, specifically modern technological systems that have reflexively shaped notions of what it means to be human beings.
